safenet.jcprov.sample
Class GenerateKey

java.lang.Object
  safenet.jcprov.sample.GenerateKey

public class GenerateKey
extends java.lang.Object

This class demonstrates the generation of keys.

The types of keys supported are :-

  • des single DES key
  • des2 double length Triple DES key
  • des3 triple length Triple DES key
  • rsa RSA Key Pair

    Usage : java ...GenerateKey -keyType <keytype> -keyName <keyname> [-slot <slotId>] [-password <password>]

  • keytype one of (des, des2, des3, rsa)
  • keyname name (label) of the key to delete
  • slotId slot containing the token to delete the key from - default (0)
  • password user password of the slot. If specified, a private key is created

    generateKey

    public static void generateKey(CK_SESSION_HANDLE session,
                               CK_MECHANISM_TYPE mechanismType,
                               java.lang.String keyName,
                               boolean bPrivate,
                               CK_OBJECT_HANDLE hKey)
    Generate a symetric key.

    Parameters:
    session - handle to an open session
    mechanismType - mechanism to use to generate the key. One of :-
    CKM.DES_KEY_GEN
    CKM.DES2_KEY_GEN
    CKM.DES3_KEY_GEN
    keyName - name (label) to give the generated key
    bPrivate - true if the key is to be a private object
    hKey - upon completion, handle of the generated key

    generateKeyPair

    public static void generateKeyPair(CK_SESSION_HANDLE session,
                                   CK_MECHANISM_TYPE mechanismType,
                                   java.lang.String keyName,
                                   boolean bPrivate,
                                   CK_OBJECT_HANDLE hPublicKey,
                                   CK_OBJECT_HANDLE hPrivateKey)
    Generate an asymetric key pair.

    Parameters:
    session - handle to an open session
    mechanismType - mechanism to use to generate the key. One of :-
    CKM.RSA_PKCS_KEY_PAIR_GEN
    keyName - name (label) to give the generated keys
    bPrivate - true if the Private key of the key pair is to be a private object
    hPublicKey - upon completion, the handle of the generated public key
    hPrivateKey - upon completion, the handle of the generated private key
